resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

ursabot commented on pull request #11560:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11560#issuecomment-953724832


   Benchmark runs are scheduled for baseline = 08ed9ad9706052c4ff7898f1860cd5ef044db0ae and contender = 905cb784e257a5fd621ebbf176c6c6f9acd94ba4. 905cb784e257a5fd621ebbf176c6c6f9acd94ba4 is a master commit associated with this PR. Results will be available as each benchmark for each run completes.
   Conbench compare runs links:
   [Scheduled] [ec2-t3-xlarge-us-east-2](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/8fa3c185a83744fb84a11d628a24e695...1a50b90e2f364a41a311308fd35149e5/)
   [Scheduled] [ursa-i9-9960x](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/1b79185e58cc45e4a63e1f4c55ea2243...c6a4405d75ed4e3ebd8fdae757976f84/)
   [Scheduled] [ursa-thinkcentre-m75q](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/3718d15602154a3cbf6a5c2d13f93a4c...b3fc599b39584fd4a0c46497abf9d598/)
   Supported benchmarks:
   ursa-i9-9960x: langs = Python, R, JavaScript
   ursa-thinkcentre-m75q: langs = C++, Java
   ec2-t3-xlarge-us-east-2: cloud = True
   


--

ldacey commented on pull request #11560:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11560#issuecomment-955238555


   Is there generally a blog post for all major pyarrow releases? I can see the changes in this CHANGELOG, but I have also seen blog posts before too kind of summarizing some of the big things. 


--

westonpace commented on pull request #11560:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11560#issuecomment-956526759


   @ldacey The blog post always lags behind the release (no one wants to work on the blog post when they are frantically trying to fix all their last minute issues).  The 6.0.0 blog post is being drafted here: https://github.com/apache/arrow-site/pull/153


--

ldacey commented on pull request #11560:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11560#issuecomment-957327210


   Makes sense, thank you for the link. Is it the same situation for the conda-forge update too? I was trying to update tests for pyarrow 6 for the turbodbc library but I believe they are installing from conda instead of pip. I assume that just lags behind pypi a bit as well?
   


--

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11560#issuecomment-957343467


   Yep.  There are quite a few post-release tasks.  They are normally tracked on the mailing list: https://lists.apache.org/thread/2ccqmw5twp0p9hf3qcnzf2vf4zhl1mm6
   
   It appears conda releases are in-pr.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Since the move to release branches we haven't been updating the CHANGELOG.md file on the main branch so the versions are missing begining from release 3.0.0.
fields.summary: [Doc] Regenerate CHANGELOG.md to include all versions
